Description: Rim-sherd of a handmade Nubian bowl, black inside and outside at the rim, rest oxidised in red. The outer surface is eroded but there is a pattern of incised circles running around the rim, in the lower part a pattern of basketry or suchlike. Few voids of chaff in the matrix. The fragment is to small to recognise the rim diameter but it is larger than 20cm.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
